content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 1 to node 2 is:


```mathematica
1 -> 4 -> 5 -> 2
```
In this case, you would only return the nodes of the path and not any additional words. The path above is the shortest route from node 1 to node 2 using the provided edges and nodes. Note that the order of the nodes in the path is important, as it reflects the direction of the shortest path. If you swap the start and end points of the problem, the new shortest path would be:


```mathematica
2 -> 5 -> 4 -> 1
```
which is the reverse of the original shortest path.

The shortest path from node 2 to node 1 is:


```mathematica
2 -> 5 -> 4
```
In this case, you would only return the nodes of the path and not any additional words. The path above is the shortest route from node 2 to node 1 using the provided edges and nodes. Note that the order of the nodes in the path is important, as it reflects the direction of the shortest path. If you swap the start and end points of the problem, the new shortest path would be:


```mathematica
1 -> 4 -> 7
```
which is different from the original shortest path.
